data.title: South African Schools Players (1974-2013)
data.meta_description: The first South African Schools team was chosen in 1974. It played a home 'test' and then went to Europe on tour.
data.text:
The first South African Schools team was chosen in 1974. It played a home 'test' and then went to Europe on tour.

Scottish Schools came on tour. They played and won five matches into Rhodesia and then lost to Natal Schools in Durban and played the first SA schools team at Ellis Park. SA Schools scored five tries (two by Agie Koch) to one and won 26-9.

Each year since then an SA Schools team has been chosen, playing a variety of opponents, including Army and University Under-19 teams, its second stringers, who regularly proved difficult, and then recently against overseas teams. This year they will again play in a tournament with France, England and Wales.

For this tournament a squad of 50 players will be chosen from what the selectors have seen at Craven Week. After trials at Kempton Park, the squad will be reduced to 28.

It is interesting that Dr Craven was opposed to the selection of an SA Schools side as he did not want Craven Week to be used as trials.

It is true that the majority of Springboks who would have been eligible for selection from 1974 onwards, did not play SA Schools. This incudes Springbok captains -Theuns Stofberg, Wynand Claassen, Divan Serfontein, Naas Botha, Jannie Breedt, Tiaan Strauss, Adriaan Richter, Gary Teichmann, Joost van der Westhuizen, André Vos, Bob Skinstad, Johan Muller and Victor Matfield.

The only player to captain SA Schools and South Africa is Corné Krige.

* = Springbok

Captains of SA Scools

The first, in 1974, was big Bernard Pienaar of Paarl Gim.

SA Schools' Captains

Written by Hannes Nienaber | |

Share Corné Krige (Paarl Boys' High) is the only South African School's captain to go on and also lead the national side on to the field in a test match. Krige captained the South African School's side of 1993. He captained the national side in 18 tests.

Other Springboks captains like John Smit (Pretoria Boys' High), Francois Pienaar (Patriot) and Bobby Skinstad (Hilton College) represented the South African School's team but didn't captain their respective sides. Pienaar (1995) and Smit (2007) captained the Springboks to World Cup glory.
